result.execSummary:
The defendant Elias Jesus Gonzalez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $600.00 plus the DNA surcharges, costs and disbursements.  To be taken by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Balance to be paid while on Extended Supervision.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain employment.  Be given job and vocational training.
Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.  Parenting classes/counseling.
AODA assessment, treatment if needed.  Urine screens.  No controlled substances or alcohol.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample if not previously taken.
The Court advisedf defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms; further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.
Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Safty plan signed and filed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Elias Jesus Gonzalez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript of GUILTY PLEA/SENTENCING HEARING (42 pages) commencing JUNE 26, 2015 received and filed.
Associated with Charge #1/corrected to show AODA/Court Order for IDP Related Driver assessment was ordered
Branch 20 in trial.  Case is rescheduled for 6/26/15 at 8:30 a.m.

Attorney Robert E Webb in court, defendant Elias Jesus Gonzalez not in court, in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Elias Jesus Gonzalez in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Defendant Elias Jesus Gonzalez in custody.  James Frisch for Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by SCRAM and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Elias Jesus Gonzalez in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Elias Jesus Gonzalez in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Elias Jesus Gonzalez

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
